alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 2:19PM CDT until June 15 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM CDT/200 PM MDT/ FOR SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND NORTHWESTERN STANTON COUNTIES... At 218 PM CDT/118 PM MDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 16 miles southwest of Syracuse, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported golf ball hail 20 miles south of Coolidge at 217 PM. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Hamilton and northwestern Stanton Counties. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
